does ubuntu netbook remix run well on non-atom x86 procs
because I was thinking, what if I installed that into a wicked powerful computer
would it be better to install netbook remix or xubuntu
no lies, I do like it

if the files are all owned by you then running it then assigning ownership should work, if not then yo may be able to use: gksudo nautilus    but I'm unsure if the ownership can be given to others. You could just use chown, much easier
then run:  sudo chown -R $USER:USER folder    and it will assign to the user running the command (assuming it can use sudo)
it's far easier to use and advise in cli ;)
the cli is where a LOT of linux's power lies, it can automate and do things the gui stuff can only dream about
you can use gksudo for both if you want, sudo doesn't setup the environment correctly and will cause issues
if you want it mainly owned by root, sure (bit silly for user data)
sudo chown -R $ USER: $ USER /path/to/dir             without the spaces between the $ and U and the : and U
yes, its a variable for the user running the command, linux is a true multiuser OS so you can switch as you like, using $USER means you don't have to remember who you are
mencoder or mplayer can show it
or for quick and dirty: mencoder -identify file
